content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: USUBJID
      operator: is_not_contained_by
      value: $dm_usubjid
Operations:
  - operator: distinct
    domain: DM
    name: USUBJID
    id: $dm_usubjid
Core:
  # Need to make yaml validation accept ADAMIG
  # Will we need to prepend ADaM rules with "AD0..."? 
  # (column "Check Number" in ADaM_Conformance_Rules_v4.0 is 1-3 digits only, some with a ",1" (e.g. "37,01") )
  Id: CDISC.ADAMIG.AD0053
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when the values of USUBJID are not present in SDTM.DM
Executability: Fully Executable
Outcome:
  Message: The values of USUBJID are not present in SDTM.DM
  Output Variables:
    - USUBJID
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: ADaMIG
        Version: '1.3'
        References:
  # Origin for ADaM/ADaMIG should be defined in yaml validation schema
          - Origin: ADaM Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '53'
              Version: '1'
    # Version 4.0 for ADaM/ADaMIG should be allowed according to yaml validation schema
            Version: '4.0'
            Citations:
              - Document: IG v1.3
                Section: 3.1.1
                Item: '3'
                Cited Guidance: >-
                  ADaM IG v1.3, Section 3.1.1, Item 3:  Any variable in an ADaM dataset
                  whose name is the same as an SDTM variable must be a copy of the
                  SDTM variable,
                  and its label, meaning, and values must not be modified. ADaM adheres
                  to a principle of harmonization known as  "same name, same meaning,
                  same values."
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      # What ADaM classes will be defined? ADSL, BDS, OCCDS, OTHER?
      - ALL
  Data Structures:
    Include:
      - ADAM OTHER
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ADSL
      - DM

json.Description: Raise an error when the values of USUBJID are not present in SDTM.DM

Outcome.Message: The values of USUBJID are not present in SDTM.DM

Citations.Cited_Guidance: ADaM IG v1.3, Section 3.1.1, Item 3:  Any variable in an ADaM dataset whose name is the same as an SDTM variable must be a copy of the SDTM variable, and its label, meaning, and values must not be modified. ADaM adheres to a principle of harmonization known as  "same name, same meaning, same values."
